author: @iPhoneinCanada
title: SaskTel Expands 5G to More Rural and Indigenous Communities • iPhone in Canada Blog
text: [SaskTel](https://www.iphoneincanada.ca/2024/09/18/sasktel-takes-crtc-court-fibre/) has recently extended its [5G network](https://www.iphoneincanada.ca/2024/02/15/sasktel-5g-prince-albert/) to additional locations, including North Grove – Buffalo Pound, La Ronge, Red Earth Cree Nation, and 50 other sites, improving connectivity for rural and Indigenous communities, as well as main highways. “The expansion of SaskTel’s 5G network is paving the way for further growth in Saskatchewan, allowing families, businesses and communities to connect faster and more reliably than ever before,” said Dustin Duncan, Minister Responsible for SaskTel, in a statement to iPhone in Canada. “The speed and power of SaskTel’s 5G network will create additional opportunities in sectors like healthcare, education and agriculture, keeping Saskatchewan communities strong and vibrant.” SaskTel’s 5G network currently delivers speeds up to 1.2 Gbps, and future improvements are expected to bring even faster speeds and greater capacity. These upgrades are part of SaskTel’s investment of $440 million for the 2024/25 fiscal year, with over $2 billion to be invested over the next five years to ensure Saskatchewan remains digitally competitive.

author: Jack Snape
title: Wallabies boosted by returning Rob Valetini and Will Skelton for second Lions Test - Yahoo Sports
text:
Wallabies boosted by returning Rob Valetini and Will Skelton for second Lions Test Story by
Wallabies player Rob Valetini has overcome a calf injury and will run out at the MCG to face the British & Irish Lions in the second Test. Photograph: Con Chronis/AAP Jack Snape July 24, 2025 at 3:30 a.m. UTC · 2 min read
Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt has recalled hulking forwards Rob Valetini and Will Skelton to add much-needed muscle for the must-win second Test against the British & Irish Lions at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Saturday.
Australia were easily overpowered in the first half of the opening Test in Brisbane last week when, despite showing improvement in the second half, they could not make up for their slow start and finished 27-19 losers.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Related: Owen Farrell named on bench for Lions’ second Test against Australia
In front of an expected crowd of more than 80,000 at the MCG, Valetini will start at blindside flanker after overcoming a calf injury in a huge boost for the hosts.
The return of the John Eales medallist pushes Nick Champion de Crespigny out of the side after his debut last week. Skelton’s recovery from his own calf injury forces Jeremy Williams onto the bench.
The only other change to the starting XV is David Porecki – who suffered a head knock against Fiji two weeks ago – replacing Matt Faessler at hooker, while backrower Langi Gleeson also returns from injury and replaces Tom Hooper on the bench.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement After the team’s training session in Melbourne’s Lakeside Stadium on Thursday, Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt said the time spent in camp this week has been valuable as the team chases the quick improvement needed.
“The squad has recovered well after a very physical first Test and the week’s preparation here in Melbourne has allowed us a bit more time together,” he said.
“We took some confidence from the second half last week, but we know we’ll need to improve further against a Lions team that will bring plenty of fire to the contest on Saturday night.”
No 10 Tom Lynagh and scrumhalf Jake Gordon have been retained, despite facing intense pressure from a ferocious Lions defence last week.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Related: Melbourne’s rugby landscape opened up with Rebels’ demise – Storm are pouncing on the opportunity | Jack Snape
Some had expected Tate McDermott to be given a chance in the No 9 jersey given his Reds connection to Lynagh and his impressive performance off the bench last week, but Schmidt has retained the 26-year-old as an interchange weapon.
Melbourne product Harry Potter retains his place on the wing, while Len Ikitau and Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii remain Australia’s centre pairing as the side aims to keep the series alive for a decider in Sydney the following week.
Wallabies : 15-Tom Wright, 14-Max Jorgensen, 13-Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii, 12-Len Ikitau, 11-Harry Potter, 10-Tom Lynagh, 9-Jake Gordon, 8-Harry Wilson, 7-Fraser McReight, 6-Rob Valetini, 5-Will Skelton, 4-Nick Frost, 3-Allan Alaalatoa, 2-David Porecki, 1-James Slipper; Replacements : 16-Billy Pollard, 17-Angus Bell, 18-Tom Robertson, 19-Jeremy Williams, 20-Langi Gleeson, 21-Carlo Tizzano, 22-Tate McDermott, 23-Ben Donaldson
Advertisement Advertisement

author: ERR News
title: 'Dangerous' weather warning still in force on Estonia's coast on Saturday | News | ERR
text:
'Dangerous' weather warning still in force on Estonia's coast on Saturday News ERR News {{1730527380000 | amCalendar}} {{contentCtrl.likes}} JAGA jaga Facebookis jaga Twitteris jaga Messengeris jaga epostiga kopeeri link Stormy sea. Source: Margus Muld/ERR News
A "dangerous" weather warning has been issued along the Estonian coast on Saturday with high winds forecast. Sleet will also make roads slippery.
"Nov 2 northwest wind in inland in gusts to 17, on coast 20-25 m/s. At times rain and sleet with risk of slippery roads!" the Environment Agency wrote.
On Saturday morning the Rescue Board said Friday night's storm was slowing down. However, it stressed that high winds and slippery roads were expected.
Spokesman Siim Palu said more than 350 calls had been made to the agency in the last 24 hours, approximately half from Lääne and Pärnu counties and the islands.
"Most of them have been to remove trees that have fallen on roads and power lines," he said.
Around 14,000 were left without electricity in western Estonia and on the islands.
Weather warning on November 2, 2024. Source: Environment Agency A level two orange warning means "unusual meteorological phenomena have been forecast".
The agency advises people to be vigilant and up to date about the weather forecast: "Be aware of the risks that might be unavoidable and follow any advice given by authorities."
More information is available on the Environment Agency's website .
--
Follow ERR News on Facebook and Twitter and never miss an update!
Editor: Helen Wright, Valner Väino, Johannes Voltri

author: Faith Bugenhagen
title: The U.S. Supreme Court Allows Emergency Abortions In Idaho, But A Lack of Clarity Remains | Houston Press
text:
Thursday morning, the U.S. Supreme Court confirmed health care providers in Idaho could continue to perform emergency abortions for the time being. The formal decision comes a day after an opinion on the case was inadvertently posted on the court’s website.
The 6-3 opinion did not include a determination of the matter at the center of the challenge brought forth by the Biden Administration. The court opted to dismiss the appeal without considering whether Idaho acted within its rights or whether federal law superseded Idaho’s near-total ban on abortion.
The Emergency Medical Treatment and Labor Act requires all hospitals enrolled in Medicare to provide stabilizing care — including abortion care — to patients having a medical emergency.
“We were hoping that there would be a more substantive decision from the Supreme Court that allowed that guidance to be in place in states across the country,” Wendy Davis, senior advisor for Planned Parenthood Texas Votes, said. “That’s not what happened.”
Chief Justice John Roberts and Justices Brett Kavanaugh and Amy Coney Barrett split from their conservative counterparts. They voted to dismiss the case alongside liberal justices Elena Kagan, Sonia Sotomayor and Ketanji Brown Jackson. Justices Samuel Alito, Neil Gorsuch and Clarence Thomas joined in dissent.
The Idaho case is expected to return to the lower courts and the hands of district court judge B. Lynn Winmill, who previously blocked Idaho’s abortion law from going into effect.
Reproductive rights advocates felt the shockwaves of the Thursday decision in Texas. Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton brought forth a similar case against the Biden Administration, which is currently pending in the courts.
Paxton filed the lawsuit, challenging the federal government’s ability to require hospitals to offer emergency abortions. The U.S. Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals sided with Texas. If the ruling is challenged and goes to the Supreme Court, it will likely be heard next fall.
“There will be no relief granted to people in Texas,” Davis said. “This could have provided doctors with more flexibility in determining when they could legally intervene when a patient’s health was at risk.”
“We’re still living in the Fifth Circuit’s prohibition on applying EMTALA. It ruled that EMTALA could not trump state abortion laws,” she added. “So for Texans, that will continue to be the status quo unless or until the Supreme Court takes up this decision when it reconvenes in the fall.”
According to Davis, the matter will likely go before the nation’s highest court only if President Joe Biden is reelected. If former president Donald Trump enters into another term, Davis said his administration will almost certainly implement a different interpretation of EMTALA that prohibits its use in superseding state abortion laws.
Davis noted the longer-term concern she and other experts have is that the Supreme Court is essentially kicking the can down the road on this decision and the case involving access to a commonly used abortion drug, Mifepristone.
The nation's highest court heard oral arguments on this case in March and subsequently ruled against applying restrictions to the pill in June. However, Davis noted that their decision was based on standing.
“It has a significant impact potentially. It’s not just that we have to wait for the next Supreme Court term when they take up the substantive merits of these questions,” Davis said. “It’s the fact that there may be an intervening Trump administration that creates the kind of clarity that anti-abortion extremists are looking for and does away with the need for the court even to consider the merits of these cases.”
“We are grateful that women in Idaho were given some at least temporary relief from their state abortion law, but that is not the case for us here in Texas,” she added.

author: @infobae
title: Basta de privilegios: el mensaje del Gobierno contra los gremios en las pantallas de Aeroparque - Infobae
text:
El Gobierno publicó mensajes contra los gremios en medio de la medida de fuerza El Gobierno Nacional, encabezado por Javier Milei, intensificó su ofensiva contra los gremios aeronáuticos en medio de un conflicto que ha paralizado los vuelos de Aerolíneas Argentinas. Este viernes, los pasajeros que se encontraban en el Aeroparque Jorge Newbery fueron sorprendidos con mensajes críticos hacia los sindicatos proyectados en las pantallas del aeropuerto. Bajo el lema “Basta de privilegios”, las placas lanzadas por la Secretaría de Transporte buscaban responsabilizar a los gremios por los paros que han afectado a miles de personas en los últimos días.
Dos leyendas aparecieron en las pantallas de Aeroparque como parte de la estrategia de comunicación del Gobierno. El primer mensaje, en un tono directo, decía: “Basta de privilegios. Los gremios aeronáuticos te impiden volar mientras reclaman asientos en clase ejecutiva. Secretaría de Transporte. Ministerio de Economía. Si te están obligando a parar, denunciá al 134″. Este mensaje claramente apuntaba a uno de los beneficios más cuestionados por la administración actual: los pasajes gratuitos en clase ejecutiva para los pilotos y sus familias.
El segundo mensaje era aún más explícito al detallar las razones detrás de las huelgas: “Los gremios aeronáuticos hacen un paro porque quieren conservar sus privilegios: Pasajes gratis en clase ejecutiva, bono en dólares, sólo se movilizan con choferes”.
“Basta de privilegios. Los gremios aeronáuticos te impiden volar mientras reclaman asientos en clase ejecutiva” (Transporte) Ambos mensajes reflejan el enfoque del Gobierno en su intento de limitar los beneficios que consideran “inmorales” y que, según sostienen, no pueden seguir siendo sostenidos por el erario público en un contexto de ajuste fiscal y crisis económica.
La ofensiva del Gobierno contra los gremios aeronáuticos no se limita a la batalla mediática. En varias oportunidades, el vocero presidencial, Manuel Adorni, y el secretario de Transporte, Franco Mogetta, han puesto el foco en las condiciones laborales y los beneficios que disfrutan los pilotos de Aerolíneas Argentinas. Durante una conferencia de prensa reciente, Adorni aseguró: “Diez de los 18 asientos de clase Ejecutiva fueron reservados para pilotos y sus familias en el vuelo inaugural a Punta Cana, quienes viajaron gratis, sostenidos por todos los contribuyentes” .
“La línea del presidente Milei es combatir las castas, y los pilotos son un claro ejemplo de esto” (Mogetta) Este tipo de beneficios, que incluyen además salarios elevados, traslados pagados y días adicionales de descanso, están siendo objeto de una revisión por parte del Ejecutivo, que busca recortar lo que consideran “privilegios injustificables”. Entre las ventajas que perciben los pilotos se destacan salarios que oscilan entre los 3 y 10 millones de pesos mensuales, dependiendo de su antigüedad y la cantidad de vuelos realizados. Además, cuentan con el día libre en su cumpleaños, traslados en remises que se contabilizan como tiempo de trabajo, y acceso a pasajes gratuitos en clase ejecutiva, que han sido un punto central de las críticas gubernamentales.
El conflicto entre los gremios aeronáuticos y el Gobierno escaló en las últimas semanas, con paros que han generado cancelaciones de vuelos y afectado a miles de pasajeros. Los sindicatos, agrupados en la Asociación de Pilotos de Líneas Aéreas (APLA), reclaman mejoras salariales y rechazan lo que consideran un ajuste en la política de la empresa. Por su parte, el Gobierno busca implementar medidas de mayor control y eficiencia en Aerolíneas Argentinas, la aerolínea de bandera.
Franco Mogetta , secretario de Transporte, fue contundente en una reciente entrevista radial al referirse a las acciones que el Gobierno tomará para regular el sector: “La línea del presidente Milei es combatir las castas, y los pilotos son un claro ejemplo de esto. Tienen privilegios que no se ven en ninguna otra aerolínea del mundo. Vamos a ir a fondo en esto para que la gente pueda viajar en paz”.

author: Get News
title: Alliance Senior Care Reiterates Its Commitment to High-Quality Senior Care in Bloomfield Hills, MI | User | bigspringherald.com
text:
Bloomfield Hills' premier senior care provider, Alliance Senior Care, reaffirms its commitment to delivering exceptional home care services, ensuring seniors thrive independently with personalized, compassionate support. Experience unparalleled care tailored to your loved one's well-being. Google it at https://alliancesrcare.com for more information. Bloomfield Hills, MI - Alliance Senior Care, a cornerstone in providing senior care services, today reasserts its pledge to the communities of Bloomfield Hills and West Bloomfield Hills, MI, by continuing to offer superior home care. This declaration reinforces the agency’s dedication to meeting the demand for high-quality home care in West Bloomfield Hills, MI, emphasizing its commitment to enhancing the lives of seniors and their families with unparalleled support. The agency's sustained focus on delivering personalized, compassionate care ensures that every family seeking senior care in Bloomfield Hills, MI, can expect exceptional service tailored to the well-being and comfort of their loved ones at home.
“At Alliance Senior Care, we understand the importance of maintaining the highest standards of care for our seniors,” said Dina Hurnevich, owner of Alliance Senior Care. “Our unwavering commitment to the community drives us to continually improve and adapt our services to meet the evolving needs of families in Bloomfield Hills and West Bloomfield Hills. By focusing on personalized, compassionate care, we ensure that each senior in our care experiences a fulfilling, dignified life.”
Alliance Senior Care’s approach is deeply personalized, aiming to meet each client's unique needs. From essential assistance with daily activities to comprehensive care plans, this tailored strategy guarantees seniors an enhanced quality of life, fostering independence, comfort, and overall well-being.
For more information about Alliance Senior Care and their senior care in Bloomfield Hills, MI , please visit their website at https://alliancesrcare.com

Known for its commitment to excellence and a team of compassionate care professionals, Alliance Senior Care delivers a comprehensive range of services designed to cater to the diverse needs of the elderly community. Committed to improving the lives of seniors and their families, Alliance Senior Care is the preferred choice for those seeking quality, compassionate care in the comfort of their homes.

author: rebecah
title: Sopranos’ Drea de Matteo Reveals Staggering Amount She Makes From OnlyFans
text:
A Sopranos star is revealing how making an account on OnlyFans saved her house from going into foreclosure.
But first, let’s take a look at the top celebrity earners on OnlyFans…
Some of the names on the list might surprise you!
Belle Delphine is one of the top earners on OnlyFans!
The cosplay model reportedly earns $1 million a month, making her number 12 on the list of wealthiest creators.
Iggy Azalea
Also on the list is Iggy Azalea, who earns around $9.2 million each month from creating content on the platform.
Her monthly subscription price is $25 and is estimated to generate around $307k in just one day!
Coco Austin
Just below Iggy is Coco Austin, an American TV personality and wife of rapper Ice T.
She charges $19 a month to subscribers, and reportedly makes around $9 million each month.
Mia Khalifa
Former adult actress Mia Khalifa is also high on the list of Onlyfans’ biggest earners.
Her monthly subscription price is only $12, but her account offers the opportunity to purchase content bundles. Because of that, she reportedly makes $6.2 million a month.
Tana Mongeau
Next on the list is YouTuber Tana Mongeau, who offers up her subscription to fans for free!
Despite being able to view a lot of her content for free, she is reportedly making $3 million a month.
For the boys….
Other top earners on the platform include rapper Casanova, reality star Safaree Samuels, and Youtuber Nikocado Avocado, who each earn between $500k and $2 million every month.
Megan Barton Hanson
Love Island’s Megan Barton Hanson is also on the list, estimated to earn around $1.9 million per month.
Erica Mena
Love & Hip-hop: New York star Erica Mena reportedly earns a whopping $4.49 million!
Denise Richards
And rounding out the list is actress Denise Richards, who reportedly earned $2 million on the platform.
Bhad Bhabie
Bhad Bhabie also makes a fortune on OnlyFans, and she recently revealed just how much she makes every month.
A viral sensation…
Bhad Bhabie rose to fame when she appeared on an episode of Dr. Phil at just 13 years old.
“Cash me outside, how ’bout that?” quickly became her catchphrase, and led to a surprisingly successful career in the years that followed.
In addition to becoming a rapper and securing brand deals with beauty companies, she eventually started an OnlyFans account.
She launched the account just six days after her 18th birthday in April 2021…
Once her account was public, she made an astounding amount on her first day in business.
Bhabie later revealed exactly how much she made throughout 2021 on the subscription-based site.
The star took to Instagram to reveal through screenshots that she made a whopping $18 million in her first month alone!
In the following months, her income declined, making a total of $6.8 million in May 2021.
The amount shown in her screenshots came to a total of $38.6 million from April to November alone.
With so many celebrities making a great living from OnlyFans, it was only a matter of time before more signed up…
And that’s exactly what one star from The Sopranos did last year.
In August 2023, Drea de Matteo — who played Adriana La Cerva on the beloved series— announced that she was joining the content subscription service.
Now, six months into her time on OnlyFans, the 52-year-old has revealed how much money she’s made.
Apparently, her earnings were enough to pay off her mortgage in just “minutes”!
In an interview with
DailyMail, the actress said she was able to pay off her mortgage debt in just “five minutes,” which came following a time when she had just “$10 to her name.”
“They put me into foreclosure and my house had flooded, so I was trying to sell the house quickly,” she said. “I wanted to try and sell it before they took it.”
“At the same time, I lost my mom, and my other mom, who has dementia, had run out of money for her caregiver,” she continued. “I didn’t know which way was up.”
Luckily for Drea, things quickly turned around after joining OnlyFans…
“I was like, holy s**t. In five minutes, I was able to pay back compass real estate who kept the sale of my house.”
“I did it, but I didn’t want to do it,” the actress admitted. “I got a lot of heat for doing it and it went f***ing viral and people went nuts.”

author: CBS News
title: Bernie Sanders, AOC drawing big crowds in Republican strongholds - CBS News
text: Wednesday afternoon, Bernie Sanders and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez visited a packed arena full of supporters in Montana. CBS News political correspondent Nidia Cavazos reports on the tour.
